intro: Psychotria cyclophylla, commonly known as the "Cyclophylla Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but have a mild, somewhat bitter taste. Psychotria cyclophylla is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
